intro: Linaria amethystea f. subalpina, commonly known as the alpine toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a compact, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive spurred petal, characteristic of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Linaria amethystea f. subalpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
